Author: SemicolonButterfly
Text: *looks suspiciously at computer* Those BMR numbers sound wildly inaccurate to me too (too low). Plus, yeah, the statement about needing to eat under your bmr is garbage. So, that software is suspect. That said, I dunno how meaningful an average BMR value even is when it’s such a function of height and weight (and age for that matter) - I’d think the standard deviation would have to be pretty large.

Author: SubWhereItHappens
Text: They want tdee, not bmr. You have to eat under your tdee to lose weight.
